addons.name: Tab Slideshow
addons.description: Cycles through tabs as a slideshow.
addons.fullDescription:
A minimalist extension that offers a configurable time to automatically switch to and display the next tab (and wrap around from the last to the first tab). The slideshow can be customized to auto-refresh tabs, as well as go into slideshow immediately when you open the browser.

Quick HOWTO: To start and stop the slideshow, find the "Start Tab Slideshow" menu item under the "Tools" menu (or on recent Windows versions, the orange Firefox app button). To change delay and refresh settings, go to the Add-ons Manager, find the extension in the list, and click the Options button (or "Preferences" on a Mac).

addons.name: Tab Rotator
addons.description: The Tab Rotator automatically switches between the open tabs of a browser window after a certain amount of time.
addons.fullDescription:
The Tab Rotator can be started and ended either by pressing Shift+F11 or by clicking on View -> rotate Tabs or by clicking on the Tab Rotator Icon, once it is added to the User Interface.

The time interval after which the next tab should be shown, can by adjusted via the Addons Settings-Page and can be set between 1 second and 23 hours, 59 minutes and 59 second.

screenshots.caption: The menu entry to start the Tab Rotator.
The Preferences Window for the Tab Rotator

addons.name: Mozilla Firefox hotfix
addons.description: This official add-on enables Firefox to provide quick fixes for selected issues.
addons.fullDescription: This official add-on enables Firefox to provide quick fixes for selected issues. There is no need to install this add-on; starting in Firefox 11, it will be automatically installed. For more information, see: https://wiki.mozilla.org/Features/Desktop/Add-on_hotfix
